Package org.cvs.application.api

Class ApplicationUserController

java.lang.Object
org.cvs.application.api.ApplicationUserController
@Controller
@RequestMapping(path="/users")
public class ApplicationUserController
extends java.lang.Object
REST service endpoint for application user services available on /users.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yamiko J. Msosa

    ApplicationUserController()

  • Constructor Details

    • ApplicationUserController

      public ApplicationUserController()

  • Method Details

    • addNewApplicationUser

      @PostMapping(path="") @ResponseBody public ApplicationUser addNewApplicationUser​(@RequestBody ApplicationUser user)
      Adds a new application user via POST through URL: /users.

      Example payload: { "fullName" : "New User", "password" : "testpass", "username" : "testuser" }

      Parameters:
      user - the user (can be a JSON payload) to be added to the system.
      Returns:
      the newly added application user

    • updatePortfolioWithUser

      @PostMapping(path="/{userId}/portfolios/{portfolioId}") @ResponseBody public Portfolio updatePortfolioWithUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long userId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId)
      Updates a new portfolio to an existing application user via POST through URL: /users/{userId}/portfolios/{portfolioId}.

      Example URL: /users/1/portfolios/4

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to associate with the portfolio
      portfolioId - the ID of the portfolio to associate with the user
      Returns:
      the newly added portfolio

    • getUser

      @GetMapping(path="/active/{userId}") @ResponseBody public ApplicationUser getUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long userId)
      Fetches an active application user via GET method through URL: /users/active/{userId}.

      Example URL: /users/active/1

      Parameters:
      userId - the user ID as a request parameter to be used in the search query
      Returns:
      an active application user if found

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{userId}") @ResponseBody public java.lang.String deleteUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long userId)
      Deletes an application user via DELETE method through base URL: /users/{userId}.

      Example payload: /users/1

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to be deleted from the system.
      Returns:
      a string that says 'Deleted'

    • retireUser

      @PostMapping(path="/retire/{userId}") @ResponseBody public java.lang.String retireUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long userId)
      Retires an application user via POST through URL: /users/retire/{userId}.

      Example payload: /users/retire/1

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to be retired from the system.
      Returns:
      a string that says 'Retired'

    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping(path="") @ResponseBody public java.lang.Iterable<ApplicationUser> getAllUsers()
      Fetches all active application users via GET through URL: /users/all.
      Returns:
      a list of all active application users in JSON or XML depending on client preferences
